Package world

Class QueensChamber

Object
world.QueensChamber
public class QueensChamber
extends Object
The queen's chamber is where the mating ritual between the queen and her drones is conducted. The drones will enter the chamber in order. If the queen is ready and a drone is in here, the first drone will be summoned and mate with the queen. Otherwise the drone has to wait. After a drone mates they perish, which is why there is no routine for exiting (like with the worker bees and the flower field).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    QueensChamber()
    Create the chamber.

    Modifier and Type Method Description

  • Constructor Details

    • QueensChamber

      public QueensChamber()
      Create the chamber. Initially there are no drones in the chamber and the queen is not ready to mate.

  • Method Details

    • enterChamber

      public void enterChamber​(Drone drone)
      A drone enters the chamber. The first thing you should display is:

      *QC* {bee} enters chamber

      The bees should be stored in some queue like collection. If the queen is ready and this drone is at the front of the collection, they are allowed to mate. Otherwise they must wait. The queen isn't into any of this kinky multiple partner stuff so while she is mating with a drone, she is not ready to mate again. When the drone leaves this method, display the message:

      *QC* {bee} leaves chamber

      Parameters:
      drone - the drone who just entered the chamber

    • summonDrone

      public void summonDrone()
      When the queen is ready, they will summon the next drone from the collection (if at least one is there). The queen will mate with the first drone and display a message:

      *QC* Queen mates with {bee}

      It is the job of the queen if mating to notify all of the waiting drones so that the first one can be selected since we can't control which drone will unblock. Doing a notify will lead to deadlock if the drone that unblocks is not the front one.
      Precondition
      A drone is ready and waiting to mate

    • dismissDrone

      public void dismissDrone()
      At the end of the simulation the queen uses this routine repeatedly to dismiss all the drones that were waiting to mate. #rit_irl...

    • hasDrone

      public boolean hasDrone()
      Are there any waiting drones? The queen uses this to check if she can mate, and also in conjunction with dismissDrone().
      Returns:
      if there is still a drone waiting
